casebody.data:
Commonwealth v. Myers. A hearing on an application to be admitted to bail will not be granted by the supreme court until a copy of the record, bills of exceptions and assignments of error, are filed in the court. Jan. 19, 1890.

Jan. 19, 1890.

Application of James Edward Myers to be admitted to bail, pending an appeal from the O. & T. Co. Before a full bench. Per Curiam,

The application for a hearing upon this motion is denied, with leave, however, to renew the motion when we are furnished with a copy of the record, bills of exceptions and assignments of error.
